title: Thunderbird cannot send or receive e-mails from iinet server
content: Thunderbird cannot connect to my iinet account. This has been working fine up until today. iinet can't/won't help on this one.
creator: bryony.hardy

title: impossibile ricevere la posta in arrivo
content: da qualche giorno da thunderbird riesco a mandare le mail ma non riesco a scaricarle
creator: invernizzi.alberto

title: One filter  for several accounts
content:
Thunderbird filters

Example: I want to automatically delete incoming messages from one sender in all GMX accounts (I have 4 of them). Is this possible? If not, is it worth for an enhancement?

Best regards, Hans
creator: hrreichardt

title: tags in subfolders
content: SHORT VERSION: Is it possible to make hunderbird show me, in the main window, that there is a tagged email ALSO inside a subfolder? EXPLANATION I am trying to be tidy and organised in my work emails with Thunderbird ;) Therefore I BOTH divide emails in subfolders AND flag the emails I have to postprocess but I don't have time right when I receive them. BUT I STILL HAVE TO POSTPROCESS THEM!!! However, if a flagged email is in a subfolder, Thunderbird doesn't show me that is flagged. In other words, if I want to see if there are unprocessed emails, I would have to enter each subfolder (which I don't do - so I don't postprocess the email! (angel) )
creator: marchetto.chiara0

title: migrare la mia posta scaricata su una chiavetta USB su thunderbird
content: dovrei migrare la mia posta scaricata su una chiavetta USB su thunderbird come posso fare? grazie
creator: rosannafacchino366

title: INOLTRO EMAIL
content:
Buongiorno, ho un problema con un cliente a cui abbiamo installato thunderbird (ultima versione), dove ci sono configurati 4 account. Due di questi sono delle gmail ( draco e studiotecnico ) configurate in IMAP. Quando si INVIA una mail da draco quest'ultima viene inviata doppia, invece quando viene inviata una mail da studiotecnico ne invia 1a come studiotecnico e 1a come draco (stessa data e ora).

Questi account sono configurati anche su un altro pc sempre con thunderbird (il problema non si presenta). Ho controllato e non c'è nessun filtro / inoltro impostato.
creator: assistenza7

title: THUNDERBIRD - příjem mailů, které jsou šifrovány S/MIME
content: Od jedné státní instituce dostávám maily, které jsou z jejich strany šifrovány v S/MIME. Potřeboval bych poradit, jak nastavit Thunderbird, abych je dokázal přečíst (obsahuji vzdy krátký text a přílohu s daty ve formě xml souboru). Aktuálně vidím jen prázdné okno (viz příloha). Děkuji za pomoc a zdravím.
creator: stanislav.kazda

title: desaparece impresora
content: Hola. He instalado Thunderbird en un nuevo ordenador y la impresora aparece y desaparece a la hora de imprimir los mails. La única opción es reinicializar el equipo, pero luego vuelve a desaparecer la impresora y sólo es visible la opción "guardar como pdf". ¿Cómo solucionar?
creator: finanzas.idi

title: Since update Thunderbird has stopped showing me my new/unread emails first
content:
Before the latest update my emails would load and the viewing pane would go straight to the top of my latest emails received (unread). I am not exactly talking about the order of emails, I have my oldest (read) emails at the top and then newer ones at the bottom, that is fine and how I like it. I do not want the newest emails at the top. But when it used to load it would highlight the first new (unread) email and I could then just go through all my newest emails in date received order.

Now when it opens it keeps them in date order (oldest to newest) which is how I like it BUT it highlights the first email in the list (from 2018).

How do I get it to move to and highlight the current (unread) emails on start up ?
creator: antb1874

title: Timbro su mail
content: Ho aggiornato il programma e mi è sparito il timbro a fondo pagina mail. Come posso reinserirlo? Grazie in anticipo a chi cortesemente mi potrà aiutare. Luca
creator: l.fissore.arch

title: Email on a Samsung A21S Android mobile phone
content:
I have been using the Samsung email app on my phone for a few years. However I can now receive emails but cannot send. I have spoken to Samsung and after some help they referred me to my Provider. I rang Plusnet who told me they do not support Thunderbird any more - although my PC receives and sends Thunderbird emails. What do I need to do please? Regards 

Brian
creator: brian251

title: Is it possible to set default thread display to collapsed/minimised state?
content:
Since I had to re-insstall Thunderbird the default setting for all threads in my inbox on open/refresh is fully expanded. I'll collapse the uppermost threads, or even go to "'View' > 'Threads' > 'Collapse all threads' ", and if I change to another folder, when I return to main inbox all threads are expanded again. If there's a quick trick to change the default setting that would be great, thank you!


(I have read this solution before: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1171612)
creator: loberto

title: Event Time Offset
content: Since updating to Supernova (115.4.1 64-bit Windows 10), we have encountered many issues with the schedule time of the calendar event invitation. We noticed that it's offset by 40 minutes. By the way, we are in UTC+8 (Malaysia Time Zone) and the calendar is sync thru Icewarp (115.4.1)'s CalDAV. One event received in Yahoo! Mail is even worse; offset to 18 hours earlier. How can we troubleshoot this issue. We are very sure that the issue is caused by Thunderbird as the inviter using CalDAV. Thank you.
creator: woo.kc

title: emails
content: Why am I not receiving emails
creator: argreen1950

title: http links in emails show grey
content: Why do copied http links show grey when I compose new emails since upgrade to Thunderbird 115? How do I get them to show in black?
creator: a.beal

title: Dlaczego nie mogę użyć "odpowiedz wszystkim". Thunderbird 115.4.1 (32 bity)
content: Dlaczego nie mogę użyć "odpowiedz wszystkim". Thunderbird 115.4.1 (32 bity)
creator: MARIAN1000

title: Subfolders without blu icon for new mail
content:
Hallo, I'm using TB 115.4.1 (32bit) and I'm still experiencing the problems I encountered when I upgraded to 115 from older version.

All the filters acting on the subfolders are working normally BUT they don't evidence the parent folder: practically the new mail is redirected in the correct subfolder but I am not able to realise that, because no blue icon appears in the parent folder.

Please fix it, otherwise the filters have no sense to exist!!

mauro
creator: mauropivato1

title: The latest versions of Thunderbird look terrible.
content: You are asking for donations for monstrosities that I no longer have any interest in. The latest version, Super-Nova, is an outright monstrosity. I lost interest in it as soon as I saw how it looked and how it performed compared to the old Thunderbird. No thanks to me, pour yourself one. A chaotic experience to see and experience. I've considered giving up Mozilla Thunderbird for good because of your indiscriminate updates.
creator: laughing.shoes

title: Unable to amually write email adresses in the To field.
content: Get red error when i write email adresses manually in the To field. Only way to put in adresses is first create an entry in the adressbook and then from the adressbook add the emailadress to the email To fields. Thunderbird version 115.4.1 (64-bit)
creator: sm0ifp

title: Thunderbird email server timeout
content: Since the latest version of Thunderbird came out I have been getting random error messages that the email server connection is timing out. This is happening with our work email server hosted by JustHost and on my personal computer and account @bellsouth.net (AT&T/Yahoo). These have not been showing up on the earlier version of Thunderbird. My phone and tablet are not giving me any error messages (email app that is on the Samsung phones connected to the Bellsouth account). If it were just at work I would suspect our hosting service but I see it at home also. So far it is not causing any big issues other than occasional delays in sending and receiving mail. Any ideas or suggestions?
creator: bstapp

title: Thunderbird levelek letöltése
content:
Kedves Ügyintéző!

Az egyik (kb. fél évvel ezelőtti) frissítés óta nem tölti le a leveleket az egyik gmail-es postafiókomból a kettő közül. Pedig ugyan azok a beállításai a két fióknak. Feldob egy külön bejelentkezési ablakot, ahol képtelenség bejelentkezni, mert 400-as hibakódot ad be. A Thunderbird újratelepítése sem oldotta meg a problémát. Így használhatatlan az egész program.
creator: zsoltzsipi

title: Fail to send emails after update (even in offline mode, seems not network related)
content:
Hi,

I updated Thunderbird this week and now seem to be unable to send e-mails.

When I write and email and hit the send button, the message "Sending of the message failed." immediately pops up. No further information is provided. With a connection issue I would expect some delay from a time out and a message from Thunderbird that it cannot reach my provider. I also confirmed via a port scan that the port is open.

When I try the option "Send mail later" (from the offline mode or using the menu option when online), I get the message: "Sorry, we were unable to save your message for sending later. Sending of the message failed."

I use Windows 10 22H2 (Build 19045.3570) and Thunderbird 115.4.1 (64-bit).

I tried - installing the 64-bit Thunderbird version over the 32-bit version that used to be installed, - rebooting my computer, - sending an e-mail over my providers web-mail interface (works), - adding Thunderbird to the Windows Defender Firewall and disabling the firewall entirely, - disabling the Windows Antivirus, - resetting my internet connection, - asked colleagues if they have trouble sending mails since the update (they don't) and compared mail settings, - confirmed that no addons are installed in Thunderbird (I had one for e-mail alerts, but it was disabled since the update, so I removed it).

IMAP and receiving emails work.

Since, even the send later option does not work, I wonder whether the issue can be related to the local Outbox folder. Any hints would be appreciated.
creator: stanley321

title: Layout Question on New Update
content: I was wondering if it is possible to make the open folder of emails on the right and then the view of the emails on the right? I have it set up on "Vertical" layout and would like all of the messages to be on the right hand side of the screen, but the view of the message in the middle between "all folders" and the open message
creator: sara42

title: Is there a way to organize accounts(Emails) into folder?
content:
I have many email accounts to manage, and recently I had to add two more email accounts for my parents, they are old and now everything is online. Is there a way to organize these accounts(Emails) into Folders.

For example I would have 5 Folders, Parents, Work, School, Personal-Govermnetal, And Anonymous.


Is that possible with Thunderbird?

Suggestion to the wonderful team of Thunderbird. Because of you guys, I have a local backup of my emails, here it goes:

1- Please make it easy to switch between profiles and make it easy to create a new profile and name the folder, and choose the location of that profile data. it is not that simple.

2- I don't want to use profiles over "Accounts-folder" or Accounts-Grouping" because even if it was quick and easy to switch between profiles, I still rather to have both Grouping of account and profiles because each is for a certain purpose to me. A profile is for a user an umbrella group of things and a folder group is a group of email for a certain use case.

to me it is simlar to how I don't want Firefox to ditch profiles and keep Multi-account container or vice versa, both are important.

3- I love you
creator: S4S4

title: Downloaded pop email disappears now after I read it. This just started. I only read it, didn't delete. And then sometimes they come back.
content: Why did my read but undeleted emails disappear from my inbox? If I close and re-open, sometimes they come back, eventually thank goodness. But this is playing havoc with my being able to file important messages after I've read them, without filing right away because I want to read them again in my inbox. ????
creator: tricia.gerrodette

title: Impossible to connect a Microsoft 365 account
content: Hi, I use a old Thunderbird version (38) for Windows Serveur 2003 and I can't connect a Microsoft 365 account. He indicate " A error with login or password" (screenshot in attachment). My password is correct, because it is OK with an other computer with recent Windows and Thunderbird version. I think the problem is with OAuth. Do you have a solution ? Thank you for your support.
creator: jordan.leroy

title: TB doesn't save email passwords
content: I am running TB Version 115.4.1 (64-bit) on a Dell laptop on Windows 11 Home 22H2. All software is up-to-date. I have been using TB for about 4 months without major issues. Suddenly I cannot send emails from any of my 3 accounts, one of which is default. I can receive without any issues on all three. I repeatedly get the error message 'Login to server smtp.titan.email with username ***@***.com failed' Accessing Titan webmail, all is well. SMTP settings in TB as shown in the server settings section for each account are all correct. In Privacy & Security the Show Passwords section is totally empty. I tick the 'Use Passwword Manager to remember the password' box, but nothing seems to happen. None of the replies to vaguely similar issues have helped. Any solutions which work most gratefully received.
creator: Sustainable

title: Need help with sending e-mails
content: I can not send an e-mail. when I type in my message and try to send I receive a box on the screen that reads sending message in progress with a blue line that's moving from left to right but the message does not go out. after a short time that message will go away and I get a message that reads sending of the message failed. I don't know what to do to fix the problem. I have worked with my provider but they don't know what the problem is Hope someone there can corret this. thank you
creator: d.b.hahn

title: TB doesn't show pdf attachment
content: With last version of TB installed (but it happened also with previous version...) in some email, coming probably from Apple Mail app, I cannot see the attached pdf file. In order to see it I have to open the fwd window, then I can find it. Please see attached pic, where you can see part of forwarded message with pdf file attached and below (red circled) the original without pdf file. Thanks in advance.
creator: fapoles

title: mail notifications blocking subject line and 1st line of email
content: hi with the new thunderbird, the notifications for the email are blockign the subjet line and the 1st line in the body
creator: bhadid

title: sent mail attachments
content:
Is there a way to delete attachments from sent mail automatically? I already have the attachments saved in my hard drive and don't need it also saved in my emails. Currently I have to do this manually for each email.

Preferably, the attachment would actually be automatically detached and replaced by a link to the location of the file in my hard drive where I originally attached the file from.
creator: gotommygo

title: Importing a "new-ish" profile
content:
Thanks, greatly, in advance, for developing and maintaining TBird. I've been active with it since at least ver. 17, and that may have been an update to the prior version already in use.

Always remember that linux systems don't get viruses. Announced as of about Sept. 19, there's a "new" one that intends to target linux systems. On Sept. 23, my main LM 21 (kernel version -86?) system went down. The virus I got did several things, the one of which I expect is key here is rewriting the permissions in the data part of the system. (Tbird very competently distinguishes the code part (/thunderbird) from the data part (/.thunderbird) .) The malicious command had to have been in the nature of chmod -R 777, but that command "hit" the data side, not the program / code side. (What this thing did do to / in the operating system partition was multiply something so as to fill immediately that entire partition. That adversely affects logging in, of course, but there were no permissions changes in that partition.)

In this recovery effort, now six weeks along, part of what I've tried includes installing older Tbird code, from ver. 102 to 115.0 (or .1), expanding the targz files, copying / moving the code part into /opt (and, then, within /opt a separate directory for each version, e.g. /ver102, and running that version from the Terminal command line with the specific path to the profile, via -profile /full/path/to/profile. Tbird has no problem finding the profile; it just immediately shifts over into, "Wouldn't you like to create a new profile?" mode.

After finding no solution in that manner, I did set up a new profile under 115.3 (whatever is current at the moment). In that setting, I can presently import an older profile just fine. (I don't have those addresses anymore, starting at least three years ago, to indicate the time issue, here.) For this older profile, the Import progress indicator stays at 0% for the longest, and then the process is completed successfully.

(I noticed that the directory created is different from the directory used in the profile at issue, but it's the exact same (independent) email server. Also, the email server uses 995 for POP3 downloads, but Tbird wanted a certificate exception allowing use of 110. No, didn't "go there." More, on resetting the server specs for that new profile I'm not intending to use, at some later time.)

Here, using that exact same Import process for the profile that was used just fine with either 115.0 or 115.1, i.e., the current version as of mid-September (the time of the malware problem), the Import process jumps immediately to 25% and then quits very promptly with nothing imported.

I have invested close to two weeks now in systematically going through every /thunderbird directory and every /.thunderbird directory to remove all otherwise inexplicable permission settings of "x" for user, group, and other. In that relevant path, the directories are either u=rwx,g=,o=, (700) or u=rwx,g=rx,o=rx (755). Some of the .so libraries were showing "x", and I've changed all of those back to u=rw,g=rw,o= (660), and all other file types are either u=rw,g=,o= (600), or u=rw,g=rw,o= (660).

I've removed the lock (link), the xulstore.json, and the session.json files more times than I can now remember. I've left the .parentlock sometimes, and removed it also on other times.

There's got to be something "simple" remaining that I'm just overlooking.

What else can i provide in the way of information to help you in figuring out how we access that profile?
creator: argentum_ag_47

title: Thunderbird 115 message header Reply, Forward buttons only show in Troubleshoot Mode
content:
[SOLUTION provided below]

[Update: It seems a lot of people are having trouble with this. I'm happy to have found the solution just now... read on.]

I accidentally installed Thunderbird 115 last night, thinking it was a Firefox update. This time I can't revert to the prior version, because I don't have a recent backup of my profile folder.

So I'm stuck with Thunderbird 115. The only major problem I see so far is, when I open a message in a new window, the Reply and Forward buttons are missing from the toolbar. Further, when I click on Customize, there is no way to add those buttons to the toolbar.

My version of Thunderbird: 115.4.1 on Mac NO ADD-ONS or THEMES installed... just default.

After digging around in Google, I decided to try Troubleshoot Mode (aka Safe Mode). To my surprise, the buttons appear in the header, however not in the toolbar. See attached screenshot. Note that this is new functionality in version 115, as noted in this article: https://blog.thunderbird.net/2023/08/make-thunderbird-yours-how-to-get-the-thunderbird-115-supernova-look

In the start of Troubleshoot Mode, I tried "Reset toolbars and controls" and "Make changes and restart" – this did not solve the problem.

Now the question is, what is different about the settings/configuration in Troubleshoot Mode vs. normal mode?

I found no settings in Settings > Config Editor that are different in either mode, except for extensions.pendingOperations and mail.uifontsize (I exported all 6,502 of them and did a diff). extensions.pendingOperations is false in normal mode and true in Troubleshoot Mode. Unfortunately, when I change it to true in normal mode, it doesn't stick – when are restart, it's back to false.

Then I found this article that describes what is disabled in Troubleshoot Mode... https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird#w_what-does-troubleshoot-mode-disable

SOLUTION: Lo and behold, the answer lies in the default chrome/userChrome.css in the Profile folder.

I commented out everything in userChrome.css, and that solved the problem – I now see the buttons in the message header as per the attached screenshot.

Here's the default CSS code in userChrome.css, with the culprit commented out... 

    #dateValueBox {       display: none     } 
    /*      #header-view-toolbox,     #otherActionsBox {     display: none !important;     }     */ 
    #expandedHeaderRows {       padding-top: 0px !important;     }
creator: jcalvert2
